name: viscously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is thick and sticky, or that has viscosity (= the quality of not flowing easily): As the water evaporates, the jam will boil more viscously. Fat drops of rain slid viscously down the window panes. The molecules flow viscously when heated, but solidify as they cool.
More examplesFewer examplesThe electric field destabilizes the flow even when this is viscously dominated and stable. This unctuous wine is lusciously rich with a viscously thick orange marmalade intensity.Both the gas and the liquid are able to flow viscously.
